weatherForecast.comment: Some valleys will initially be foggy on Saturday, while visibility on the mountains will be good with high cloud fields. The wind will be mainly light from the south. Up to 5 degrees at 2000 metres.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Lack of snow and stones are the main dangers.
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. There is usually not enough snow for snow sports and avalanches can hardly be triggered.

snowpackStructure.comment: There is no closed snow cover, snowpack and the terrain is mostly bare.

weatherForecast.comment: Some valleys will initially be foggy on Saturday, while visibility will be good on the mountains with high cloud fields. The wind will be weak to moderate from the south. At 2000 m around 3 degrees, at 3000 m around -3 degrees, frost line: 2300 - 2600 m.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Low-volume wind slab and rare avalanche prone locations in the persistent weak layer
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Small avalanches in particular can still be triggered by individuals in a few places in the shady slope high alpine regions above 2600 metres. On the one hand in the fresh wind slab snow of the last few days, on the other hand very occasionally in weak layers in the persistent weak layer. In addition to the risk of burial, the risk of falling and injury should be taken into account.

snowpackStructure.comment: On the sunny slopes, the snow cover, snowpack is soaked up to high altitudes during the daytime changes. On the shady slope, it often remains hard-frozen on the surface, below which there is partly unbound edged snow at altitude, which can serve as a weak layer in exceptional cases. This is the case, for example, over the hard old snow from early winter. The snow depth is well below average at all altitudes.

weatherForecast.comment: Some valleys will initially be foggy on Saturday, while visibility will be good on the mountains with high cloud fields. The southerly wind will be mainly weak, in the south moderate in the afternoon. At 2000 metres between 2 and 5 degrees, frost line around 2300 - 2600 metres.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Injury from stones and falling are the main dangers.
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Only very rarely can fresh drift snow packs be triggered by individuals in shady slopes, avalanches remain small. In areas adjacent to the ridgeline, crests or summits, there are isolated trigger points for predominantly small avalanches that are difficult to disturb, even in persistent weak layers.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow depth is well below average for the time of year, low to medium elevations and the sunny slopes are widely covered in snow. The snow cover, snowpack is soaked up to high altitudes on the sunny slopes during the daytime changes, in the shade it often remains frozen hard. At high altitudes on the shady slopes, weak layers of faceted crystals still remain in the snow cover, mostly in the vicinity of crusts.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Locally, thin wind slabs cover dangers due to lack of snow.
